channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Hole in footbridge, 4th November
item.description:
I reported this the other week and your reply was that it was Network Rails problem. I contacted them and they say it is not their bridge and to contact Bromley Council!! I am really concerned that the whole bridge may be rusting and the job is being passed from one person to the next. Please can you confirm if the council is taking responsibility. Have attached screenshot of Network Rails problem reply.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Ivy Bridge, Widmore, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Pile of rubbish left on pavement everyday, 4th November
item.description:
Large pile of rubbish is regularly left on the pavement in the way of pedestrians by a sign post. Not the correct area for leaving waste.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 10-12, Berners Street, Fitzrovia, Camden Town, City of Westminster

item.title: Outside dexter apartments, 4th November
item.description:
Dog fouling on the street alongside dexter apartments, very disgusting, dont want to have to dodge this while on the school run! Don't want this to spread further all over the road, please can this be cleaned up

item.category: Fly-tip Small - Less than one bag

item.title: Litter and leaves, 4th November
item.description:
I wrote yesterday advising of litter and leaves on our street, today you advised it’s ‘resolved’ but nothing has been done. Terrible service. See photos attached. Please sort it out and implement a long term solution this has been a problem for months.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Tottenham Road, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Litter on Tabard street, 4th November
item.description:
There are plastic bags, clothes, food packaging and plastic bottles are Tabard Street and road along Becket House and Student building. This was not been cleared despite Fixmystreet stating it had been removed.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 28-52, Pilgrimage Street, The Borough, London

item.title: 3 abandoned litter bins obstructing pavement, 4th November
item.description:
3 abandoned litter bins obstructing pavement. Situated right near a tree. Makes it really difficult to get past (wheelchair and pram especially). Ive repeatedly complained about this. The bins used to be left there by no 20 vernham road . These bins are un-numbered. They attract fly tipping also.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Vambery Road, Shooters Hill, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Litter and tons of leaves on pavement and road, 4th November
item.description:
Pavement needs to be cleaned of leaves and litter all down Thorngate Road and into turning circle.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 3, Thorngate Road, Maida Vale, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Water leak on footpath to erith station, 4th November
item.description:
The water leak down the path towards erith station has been happening for over a year. The water smells like it is contaminated or is sewage. With the leaves it is a slip hazard and people are having accidents as half the path is now permanently wet and leaves are mixed in. The weather is getting colder and once it starts the freeze over, this will be an even more serious hazard.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Stonewood Road, Northumberland Heath, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Recycling not collected at 98 Colthurst Crescent, 4th November
item.description:
Today the recycling wasn't collected from the bin shed at 98 Colthurst Crescent. This has been occurring more frequently. Would you be able to address this asap as the bin shed is full.
Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Colthurst Crescent, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Water / sewage leak and slip hazard on the hill, 4th November
item.description:
This water leak has been happening for over a year. The water smells like it is contaminated or is sewage. With the leaves it is a slip hazard and people are having accidents as half the path is now permanently wet and leaves are mixed in. The weather is getting colder and one it starts the freeze over, this will be a serious hazard.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Bexley Road, Northumberland Heath, London
Report on FixMyStreet
